intro: Borneacanthus stenothyrsus, commonly known as the Bornean thorned bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the island of Borneo. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in lowland and hill forest areas, often in shaded, moist environments. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a waxy coating, while its stems are woody and covered in small thorns. Borneacanthus stenothyrsus is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and restricted geographic distribution.
